noun.description: A regenerating agent. In later use chiefly Chemistry: a substance used to restore the function of an ion-exchange resin, adsorbent, or similar medium.
Biology. A living organism, cell, etc., produced by regeneration from (part of) another of its kind; (in later use) especially a plant produced by regeneration from cell or tissue culture.

origin: Early 18th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin regenerant-, regenerāns, present participle of regenerāre.
